or Bartter syndrome type V.  There are two types of autosomal dominant hypocalcemia distinguished by their genetic cause. The signs and symptoms of the two types are generally the same.",GHR,autosomal dominant hypocalcemia
How many people are affected by autosomal dominant hypocalcemia ?,The prevalence of autosomal dominant hypocalcemia is unknown. The condition is likely underdiagnosed because it often causes no signs or symptoms.,GHR,autosomal dominant hypocalcemia
